question: A patient believes he is the most impoant person in the world than anyone so his neighbors and family is trying to harm him as they are jealous of him. His wife says otherwise and says he behaves like this recently only before he was working as a school-teacher peacefully and brought to OPD. He is suffering from:
options:
A. Delusion of grandiosity
B. Delusion of persecution
C. Delusion of grandiosity and persecution
D. Delusion of grandiosity, persecution and reference
answer: D. Delusion of grandiosity, persecution and reference

question: Z tracking technique is used in?
options:
A. Administering long acting antipsychotic
B. Lithium monitoring
C. Carbamazepine monitoring
D. Nicotine patch

question: Provision of WHO mental action gap are all, except:
options:
A. Human rights
B. Communication regarding care and career
C. Screening family members
D. Social suppo

question: All are causes of subcortical dementia except -
options:
A. Alzheimer's disease
B. Parkinson's disease
C. Supranuclear palsy
D. HIV associated dementia

question: Which of the following is not an adverse effect of Escitalopram?
options:
A. Nausea
B. Vivid dreams
C. Anorgasmia
D. Sialorrhoea

question: About depersonalization, which of the following is false:
options:
A. More common in females than male
B. Common in patients with seizure and migraine
C. Common with post life threatening accidents
D. Reality testing is lost

question: Most common complication of ECT is -
options:
A. Antegrade amnesia
B. Retrograde amnesia
C. Psychosis
D. Depression

question: A person with histrionic, shy, anxious avoidant per!sonality comes under which cluster?
options:
A. A
B. B
C. C
D. D

question: A 40 years old male with history of fall and one episode of vomiting near an alcohol shop. He was brought to casualty and he was awake with open eyes and had retrograde amnesia. Which of the following is most likely cause?
options:
A. Diffuse axonal injury
B. Concussion
C. Drunkenness
D. Cerebral venous thrombosis

question: A young girl hospitalised with anorexia nervosa is on treatment, Even after taking adequate food according to the recommended diet plan for last 1 week, there is no gain in weight, what is the next step in management:
options:
A. Increase fluid intake
B. Observe patient for 2 hours after meal
C. Increase the do se of anxiolytics
D. Increase the caloric intake from 1500 kcal to 2000 kcal per day
answer: B. Observe patient for 2 hours after meal

question: SPIKES protocol is used for:
options:
A. Triage
B. Communication with patients/attendants regarding bad news
C. Writing death ceificate
D. RCT
answer: B. Communication with patients/attendants regarding bad news

question: Not a side effect of Escitalopram?
options:
A. Nausea
B. Vivid dreams
C. Anorgasmia
D. Sialorrhoea

question: An individual with a known psychiatric disorder or on treatment and is not a minor can chose to decide the care taker and the course of treatment according to mental health act. This is called:
options:
A. Advance directive
B. Treatment directive
C. Mental will
D. Future directive

question: Which of the following best describes paradoxical suicide?
options:
A. Suicide after taking low dose of drug
B. Suicide occurring at the time when the pt. stas to recover
C. Suicidal tendency increase as the patient improves
D. Accidental completion of suicide
answer: B. Suicide occurring at the time when the pt. stas to recover

question: A man comes with history of abnormal excessive blinking and grunting. He says he has no control over his symptoms, which have risen in frequency of late. This has staed affecting his social life making him depressed. Which of the following medications should be used in him?
options:
A. Risperidone
B. Imipramine
C. Carbamazepine
D. Methylphenidate

question: A young male patient is on 5 mg haloperidol for many days, recently for last 4 days of duration he has inner restlessness and urges to move. Diagnosis is?
options:
A. Akathisia
B. Tardive dyskinesia
C. Rabbit syndrome
D. Acute Dystonia
